channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Myanmar’s War Has Made It the Global Crime Capital
item.description: The chaotic country is now a magnet for criminal syndicates, particularly from China, destabilizing law enforcement across much of Asia.

item.title: South Korea Clears Way to Detain President in Martial Law Inquiry
item.description: The police are investigating whether President Yoon Suk Yeol tried to lead an insurrection when he declared martial law and plunged the country into c...

item.title: Migrant Chinese Muslims in NYC Say They Now Fear Trump
item.description: At a shelter in the Flushing area of New York, Hui Muslims who fled oppression in China are concerned about the president-elect’s vows to tighten asyl...

item.title: California will require home insurers to expand coverage in wildfire-prone areas after top carriers stopped offering new policies
item.description: In exchange for increasing coverage, insurers will be able to consider climate change when setting their prices.

item.title: Treasury Department says a China state-sponsored cyberattack gained access to workstations and documents
item.description: The incident happened earlier this month, when a third-party cybersecurity service provider was compromised.

item.title: Pentagon Releases Detainee Held at Guantánamo Since Day 1

item.title: Pentagon Appeals Court Upholds Plea Deals in Sept. 11 Case
item.description: The three-judge decision appeared, at least for now, to put plea proceedings for Khalid Shaikh Mohammed and two others back on track to take place in ...

item.title: Syrian Refugees in Germany Are Glad They Can Visit Home. But Just Visit.
item.description: The more than one million Syrians who fled to Germany have celebrated the end of war in their homeland, but some fear it could mean losing their refug...

item.title: Jet carrying Gonzaga basketball team nearly collides with Delta plane at LAX—audio captures frantic ‘stop, stop, stop’ from air traffic control
item.description: A plane operated by Key Lime Air nearly collided with a Delta aircraft that was taking off around 4:30 p.m. No one was injured.

item.title: FBI warns crime gangs are stalking NFL and NBA stars on social media—Travis Kelce and Luka Doncic among burglarized

item.title: Americans are increasingly falling behind on their credit card bills, flashing a warning sign for the economy
item.description: The amount of credit card debt written off through the first three quarters of 2024 reached $45.7 billion, up 46% from the same period a year ago.

item.title: Migrants Arrested in Killing of Mexican Immigration Agent
